alert.note: Alert for Ellsworth; McPherson; Rice; Saline (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 31 at 12:18AM CDT until May 31 at 6:15AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wichita has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Ellsworth County in central Kansas... Northwestern McPherson County in central Kansas... Northern Rice County in central Kansas... Central Saline County in central Kansas... * Until 615 AM CDT. * At 1218 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated training thunderstorms producing very heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Salina, Marquette, Chase, Assaria, Gypsum, Geneseo, Smolan, New Cambria, Falun, Frederick, Kanopolis State Park, Kanopolis Lake, Bridgeport, Salina Airport, Kipp and Silica. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Do not drive into flooded areas or go around barricades. Nearly two feet of water will carry most vehicles away. Turn around, don`t drown. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
